summary: Overhauling Jewellery to make many more combinations of gems/metal, add circlets and new meshes down the track to really spice up the whole category. The main aim of this mod as it grows will be to add many more types of gemstones and jewels combinations to craft and enhance the look of your character.
descriptionHtml:
JewelCraft (Craft enhancment and expansion)
**************************************************************
V0.20
[IMG]http://i43.tinypic.com/29eohp4.png[/IMG]
LATEST NEWS

IMPORTANT!
Sorry it has been so long since the last update but I have been VERY busy with work and going back to university. Please read the next section as it can save your game from breaking!

JewelCraft V0.20 has had some major FormID changes so that it will work in the CK.
Thank you very much to blove for doing this in advance and saving me hours of work!

However. This means there may be issues with existing items that are worn. PLEASE back up your save files before updating and when you do take all jewellery you are wearing off (circlets inlcuded) then load the new JewelCraft and Then put it back on. test, then save. Otherwise BAD things might happen.

I have added all of the Single stone Ebony amulets now. Amethyst, diamond, sapphire, ruby, topaz, garnet, emerald and onyx.

Background
----------------
Ok, I used to be a jeweller and games often irk me with the way they implement jewellery. But in Skyrim there were 2 things that were slightly annoying and 1 that was utterly UNFORGIVABLE!

The annoying first. Jewellery was made craftable *YAY* but they didn\'t allow you to craft circlets. This has been fixed. The other annoying thing is that there are a few rings and amulets in the game but missing a large combination of metals and stones. I mean they don\'t even have a silver sapphire ring WTF?! So this mod will be aiming to add those things and also differnet combinations of circlet/jewllery gems. I will also be making alot of new meshes of different jewellery designs to really spice things up. So stay tuned.

THE UNFORGIVABLE! Steel.... It is made of carbon and iron.... not corundum and iron. For those out there who don\'t know gemology, corundum is the crystal \'family\' that sapphires and rubys belong to. So I have modded corundom and renamed it copper ore and copper ingot. The items that used them in their formula still do, with the exception of steel which is now made with iron ore and 2 charcoal. These actually end up being quite realistic as copper is somtimes used in alloys to harden soft metals and the meshes Including the viens actually look like copper. The other material oddness that irked me was malachite. Also ABSOLUTLY NOTHING to do with glass. So it has been renamed Moldavite which actually IS a type of rare natural green glass. All glass formulas have been left the same, just renamed.

I will be adding alot more different alloys of metal and alot more different gemstones and jewellery combinations they can be made in to. This will also include more grades of gems. I will do as much as I can for now, but a lot of work might have to wait until the construction set has been released. That way I could make things much faster.

Instructions
*****************
unzip the entire archive into:
Steam\\SteamApps\\common\\skyrim\\Data

to uninstall delete \'JewelCraft.esp\' and everything in the the Meshes\\Armor\\AmuletsandRings and textures\\Armor\\AmuletsandRings folder. Obviously if you have other meshes from other mods in that folder DO NOT delete them.

*(might just leave these two as Orichalcum, cause it looks a lot like nephrite jade )

To Do List
**************
Comments on all to do list items are very welcome! Communities are what make mods grow!

Rebalance costs of either gems or circlets. Doesn\'t make sense that a sapphire is 400g while the circlet is only 250g and has 3 of them in there. I will either be doing this be changing costs (which will cause all sorts of balancing issues for the leveling lists) or introducing different grades of gems. The most desirable outcome would be if the better grade stones increase the colour and value of the circlets.

Add more gemstone types and grades

Add more jewellery designs and stone combinations

Might see if I can add smithing level resrictions on higher value jewellery

Down the track I would like to add jewelled gauntlets, daggers and armour

Ability to craft misc items for decorating your house like that golden bee or statues

Jewellery Quests for recipes and rare jewellery/gem artifacts

Jeweller\'s bench to do the crafting at and move all jewels to that crafting bench.

YOU ROCK!
